user.biography: Greenpeace exists because this fragile earth deserves a voice. It needs solutions. It needs change. It needs action.

node.text:
Did you know that industrial agriculture accounts for as much greenhouse gas emissions as all global transportation combined?

So, reducing your meat and dairy consumption is not only good for your health, but it’s also good for the planet.

Starting this weekend, let’s challenge ourselves to consume more plant-based meals and demand companies and governments to protect forests and reduce the industrial production of meat and dairy.

🎥: @greenpeaceth
.
.
#LessMeatMoreVeg #greenpeace #climatechange

node.text:
Every year, hundreds of Cameroonians die or are left displaced due to flooding caused by blocked drainage. 

One of the culprits is plastic pollution. 

Cameroon produces 600,000 tonnes of plastic waste every year, the highest in Central Africa. Only 20 percent of this waste is recycled.

The global plastic crisis is out of hand and it’s society’s most vulnerable who end up bearing the brunt.

Help us make African governments vote in favour of a Global Plastic Treaty 📢 Link in bio ☝️

#BreakFreeFromPlastic #PlasticFreeJuly 

via @greenpeaceafrica

#douala #cameroon #floods #africa #greenpeaceafrica #greenpeace #plasticpollution #plastic #singleuseplastic #plasticbottles #extremeweather #climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatechange #globalplastictreaty

node.title: Devastating floods and plastic pollution in Douala, Cameroon

node.text:
Aurelie, a scientist from Mauritius and daughter of a fisherman, always felt a strong connection with the ocean.
.
Growing up by a beach she witnessed the unsustainable development affecting the ocean. Her life mission is to inspire future generations to protect the ocean, starting where land meets the sea.
.
@aurelie_hector @jake_letori
.
.
.
#VitalOceanVoices #ProtectTheOceans #IndianOcean #Mauritius #Madagascar #Seychelles #Oceans #Seas #Greenpeace

node.text:
The sea is rising higher and faster — floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.

But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.

How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming.

Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.

#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #Greenpeace #jakarta #taiwan #taipei #asia #globalwarming

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

node.text:
In May, @greenpeacekorea and sand drawing team A Plan created 5 sand paintings of climate-crisis species and people on Taean Beach, South Korea to warn that the current climate crisis, accompanied by rising temperatures, would destroy our ecosystem as easily as the waves destroyed the sand drawings.

Greenpeace is urging governments to implement the Paris Agreement by 2050 so that the global average temperature does not exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius based on pre-industrial revolution standards.

We must act as we only have one planet that we call home. 
.
.
#greenpeace #ClimateCrisis #ActOnClimate

node.text:
One of the biggest oil companies in the world just revealed its secrets - to an undercover journalist from Greenpeace #Unearthed.

Exxon held back climate action for decades, and is still doing it today. We went undercover with Exxon’s lobbyists to expose the truth.

Exxon's CEO is now trying to put blame onto the individual employee but their lobbying on climate change goes back decades.

Watch and share. Link in bio ☝️

via @greenpeaceuk 

#ExxonMobil #ClimateJustice #Exxon #ExxonKnew #bigoil #fossilfuels #fossilfools #climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatebreakdown #climatescience #science #lobbying #busted #unearthed #greenpeace #greenpeaceuk #greenpeaceunearthed #journalism #investigation #undercover

node.title: EXXON EXPOSED: undercover with Exxon’s lobbyists to expose the truth

node.text:
On this Day of the Seafarer, meet Hsuan, our oceans activist from Taiwan. She has recently returned from Greenpeace’s latest voyage to Indian Ocean.

“I can be your eyes fighting on the campaign frontline, exposing ocean crisis to those of you on land”

We cannot let our oceans continue to be destroyed. Join us to #ProtectTheOceans. Check link in bio ⬆️
.
.
#DayoftheSeafarers #greenpeace #oceans #nature #climatechange

node.text:
BREAKING: World leaders have arrived in #Cornwall to attend the #G7summit. And we were there to greet them in a way they won’t forget.
.
In a world first: Illuminated drones, light projections, kids and activists have come together to deliver one united message.
.
Stop extinction, act now. Watch and share. 
.
We have just eight years left to prevent catastrophic climate breakdown, we can’t afford any more empty promises. Hope comes from action not words.
.
Massive thank you to @celestial_drones @projectionsonwalls  @hannahpeelmusic @ulsterorchestra for their amazing contribution to this incredible video message. 
.
.
#G7UK #G7Cornwall #BuildBackBetter #Cornwall #CarbisBay #Change #G7 #ClimateAction #ActNow #ClimateLeadersAct #G7summit #Activisim #Drones #Projections #environment #climate #globalwarming #nature #savetheplanet #dronestagram #droneoftheday #aerial #aerialphotography #dronephotography #CivilSociety

node.text:
Amidst the global pandemic, access to vaccines should not be hoarded by a few rich countries. The virus is everywhere regardless of boundaries or borders - it’s a threat to the whole world. 
We must waive the intellectual property on the #COVID19 vaccine so that we can make more and save more people.
Stand in solidarity to demand #VaccinesForAll! 
#VaccineSolidarity #GreenpeaceIndia #Greenpeace

node.text:
How would you feel if you woke up one day to find huge machines threatening to destroy your home? That's what's facing Pacific communities if deep sea mining starts happening: a new industry that will destroy their environment and jeopardize their livelihoods.
.
Stand in solidarity with Victor and all the communities that would have to face the dire consequences of this destructive industry. Link in our bio.
.
.
.
.
#ProtectTheOceans

node.text:
"We have to redefine what nature and earth means....to realize it's not just a source of goods..."

What does fracking mean to the affected communities and what can they do about it? Alejandra told us more in our last panel discussion on the activism and resistance of communities to extractivism in Latin America. 

Watch the full conversation in the link in our bio⬆️
.
"Tenemos que resignificar lo que significa la naturaleza y la tierra ... para darnos cuenta de que no es solo una fuente de bienes ..."

¿Qué significa el fracking para las comunidades afectadas y qué pueden hacer al respecto? Alejandra nos contó más en nuestro último panel de discusión sobre el activismo y la resistencia de las comunidades al extractivismo en América Latina.

Mira la conversación completa en el link de nuestra bio⬆️

node.title: Alejandra x extractivismo en América Latina.

node.text:
Great news 🥰👏👏👏

After a fierce long fight, civil society wins against the lobby of Gabriel Resources mining corporation 🎉

For almost 20 years, @greenpeace_romania and allies from the Greenpeace network and beyond have been protesting against the controversial Roșia Montană gold and silver project located in western central Romania.

Two days ago, the Roșia Montană Mining Landscape has been inscribed on the @unesco #WorldHeritage List & World Heritage in Danger List. The heritage and environmental value of #RoșiaMontană are officially worth more than destructive mining using cyanide.

Here's a little #ThrowbackThursday post:

📸 1 and 2: 2002 • Picture taken in Roșia Montană during an investigation focusing on industrial pollution hotspots in Central and Eastern Europe. Aerial view of a mining site in Rosia Montana. © Greenpeace / Juraj Rizman

📸 3: 2002 • Greenpeace activists and local people from Roșia Montană are holding a demonstration against the planned building of a new open pit gold mine. The banner reads "Gabriel Resources Stop Cyanide Gold Mining in Roșia Montană" in English and Romanian. © Greenpeace / Anton Ovidiu

📸 4 and 5: 2013 • 50 Greenpeace activists from 10 countries stage a gold mining operation in front of the Romanian Parliament. The activists enter the yard of the Romanian Parliament and start digging for gold. © Greenpeace / Bogdan Boja

📸 6: 2003 • Roșia Montană Action in Hungary. Activists have their faces painted to symbolise the danger of possible cyanide pollution caused by the Roșia Montană gold mine. © Greenpeace / Attila Soos

📸 7: 2018 • Greenpeace activists deliver fake money bags to the Romanian government to ironically symbolise the acquisition of Roșia Montană site. © Greenpeace

#romania #greenpeacero #greenpeaceromania #mining #apusenimountains #transylvania #goldmining #forests #unesco #44whc #gabrielresources #bucharest #deforestation #victory #goodnews #activismworks #centraleasterneurope #greenpeace #cyanide #pollution #health #water #downmemorylane #memories

Young. Wild. Endangered. 

There are only 3,900 wild tigers left in the world today.

Large-scale deforestation for commodities such as palm oil has destroyed tiger habitats, leaving them trapped in what is left of their forest homes.  
Their survival is in our hands.
.
.
.
📸 : © Harshad Barve/ Greenpeace
.
.
.

#InternationalTigerDay #RestoreForests #ForestsNotFires #SaveBiodiversity #DropDirtyPalmOil #protectparadise

node.text:
The Greenpeace #MobilityForAll Train continues to make its way across Europe, highlighting the appalling lack of investment in rail, while exposing high-cost, publicly-funded, fossil fuel-based transport projects that do irreparable damage to the environment and are extremely short-sighted as we move towards a more sustainable future.

Transport is already responsible for one-third of all greenhouse gas emissions in Austria. Nevertheless, Austria plans to build up to 118 kilometres of new highways, which will increase CO2 emissions by an additional 375.000 tons per year.

Today, @greenpeaceaustria activists installed a 12 metre long train in front of the Austrian Federal Chancellery to call for more trains and less cars. The estimated cost of 5.9 billion euros must be used to strengthen public transport instead of building relics from the fossil fuel past.

📸: © Mitja Kobal / Greenpeace

🌍 

#MobilityForAll

#MoreTrainsLessAirplanes #greenpeace #austria #vienna #mobility #transport #publictransport #trains #nighttrains #greenpeaceaustria #cleantransport #transformtransport #climatecrisis #greenrecovery #justrecovery #justtransition

node.text:
Pua Lay Peng is a local activist leading a grassroots environmental group in Jenjarom, Malaysia.

In January 2018, the global plastic waste trade was disrupted when China banned most plastic waste imports. Southeast Asian countries like Malaysia had picked up the slack, accepting the outpouring of plastic waste from high-income countries that led to a spike in the number of illegal dumpsites and burning facilities in the country. 

The imported waste, especially from illegal sources, is often not processed correctly but dumped or burned in essentially unregulated ways in places like Jenjarom and Klang, Selangor, resulting in air, soil and water pollution. 

We would say that Pua is the Malaysian version of Erin Brockovich, a concerned citizen who fought for a better environment and consequently, built a strong movement. 
.
.
#greenpeace #plastic #breakfreefromplastic #Malaysia

node.text:
Reposted from @greenpeaceafrica 
.
.
"We need stricter plastic regulations to be put in place and enforced!" - @luke.rudman 

This artwork was created by Luke Rudman from plastic collected along the South African coastline. Luke uses his art to highlight the devastating impact plastic pollution has on our environment. Follow @greenpeaceafrica for more 👀

The future of single-use plastic usage in Africa isn’t looking good.

With the recent news that the South African government is planning to oppose a multilateral Environmental Agreement (MEA) treaty in September that would effectively put an end to the import of plastics into Africa, in addition to @cocacola's blatant greenwashing campaign on PET plastic bottles in Kenya, single-use plastic and its effect on vulnerable communities in Africa is an issue that needs urgent intervention.

The South African Government has decided not to support the Global Plastic Treaty. 

Help us make this change 📢 Link in bio ☝️

node.text: Fossil fuels have poisoned our bodies, communities, and planet for long enough. A world beyond Big Oil is possible.⁣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on July 26, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, tree, outdoors and text that says 'PROTECT THE OCEANS TNA PROTECTING MANGROVES O VITA OCEAN VOICES'.

node.text:
Vital Ocean Voices you need to hear!⁣
.⁣
Today’s feature is timely as it’s International Day for the Conservation of the Mangrove Ecosystem.⁣
.⁣
In the face of impending climate change impacts, and the pressing need to build resilient ecosystems, a community based group called Anse Royale Watershed Committee joins together to restore mangrove ecosystems on the Seychelles coast to reduce vulnerability and alleviate further climate crisis.⁣
.⁣
Hear about what they’re doing to rehabilitate mangroves and protect local communities and wildlife- link in bio @greenpeace_oceans ⁣
.⁣
Mangrove forests may be the most underappreciated habitats in the world. They absorb massive amounts of carbon from the atmosphere, protect coastal communities from storm surges and are a vital nursery for juvenile fish and sharks.⁣
.⁣
Island communities in the Indian Ocean are on the frontline of the ocean crisis and their way of life is being threatened like never before. Together we must #ProtectTheOceans⁣
.⁣
#VitalOceanVoices #ProtectTheOceans #Mangroves #MangroveDay #IndianOcean #Seychelles #Oceans #Seas #Greenpeace⁣
⁣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on July 26, 2021. May be an image of ocean, sky and text that says 'WE NEED CLEAN POLITICS TO FIGHT DIRTY OIL'.

node.text:
Exactly one year ago the Wakashio -- one of the world’s largest bulk carriers ships, as it made its way from China to Brazil, and passing through the Indian Ocean -- ran aground onto a coral reef off the coast of Mauritius. A few days later, the giant vessel, operated by MOL, began leaking its fuel oil (supplied by BP) into a pristine lagoon of the East African country. ⁣
.⁣
As the ship slowly broke apart in the middle of August, Mauritius’ waters and shorelines became drenched in almost 1000 tonnes of toxic fuel oil, destroying the livelihood of countless fishermen and tourism workers. Thousands risked their health as they were fighting the oil spill often with their own bare hands and building protective booms made from their own hair.⁣
.⁣
The Mauritian government rushed to sink the front part of the Wakashio into a nursing ground of whales (despite warnings from environmental organisations). We may never know whether this action contributed to more than 50 whale and dolphin carcasses washing ashore since no information has been disclosed publicly. At least three crew members of a tugboat lost their lives, while attempting to remove as much of the oil as they could.⁣
.⁣
Sadly, the government of Mauritius chose to shield the corporations and to withhold vital information from the public. One year later, there has been no transparency about the exact kind of oil that leaked or why the front section of the ship was sunk instead of being towed away and recycled. ⁣
.⁣
The shipping and oil industries are broken. We need urgent action to push them to cut carbon emissions and align with the temperature goals of the Paris Agreement.⁣
.⁣
#MauritiusOilSpill #ClimateCrisis #EndOil⁣
#EndShipPollution ⁣
⁣

node.text:
What advice would you give to young activists?⁣
 ⁣
"You have to spend some time taking care of yourself. You have to spend some time taking care of your family, of your friends, your community." — Greenpeace International co-founder Rex Weyler.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#greenpeace #inspiration #youthactivism #activism #activist⁣
